title: Oh boy, teacher let fly over food wrapper - Nation | The Star Online
text:
Wednesday, 22 February 2017 Oh boy, teacher let fly over food wrapper Teacher’s order: The student, watched by his parents, showing how he used his mouth to pick up the food wrapper from the window pane as instructed. 
ALOR SETAR: A Form Five student was assaulted by a teacher for allegedly failing to discard a nasi lemak wrapper into a rubbish bin at a school in Kuala Nerang near here. 
The 17-year-old youth claimed he was kicked in the chest and right leg after he was spotted inserting the food wrapper into the side of a window pane while walking by a classroom at about 9.30am on Monday. 
“The teacher in the classroom saw what I did and instructed me to pick up the wrapper with my mouth as punishment. 
“I did as told but the wrapper fell onto the floor from my mouth so I picked it up with my hand. 
“That was when he became angry and assaulted me even though I apologised as he claimed I had failed to follow his instruction,” he said when met at home yesterday. 
The youth said his class teacher was informed of the incident before one of classmates sent him home to Kampung Lubuk Perong as he was in pain from the assault. 
His father, 45, who took him to a police station to lodge a report on the same day, said he could accept it if his son was canned but the “assault as punishment” by the teacher should not have occurred. 
Padang Terap OCPD Deputy Supt Ahmad Nasir Jaafar said the case was classified as voluntarily causing hurt under Section 323 of Penal Code, adding that statements from the teacher and student had been recorded by the investigating officer.
